snippet: United States and European regulators want to standardize derivatives contracts to help cross-border banks fail smoothly. It’s a reminder of how much work still needs to be done to end “too big to fail,” the author says.
abstract: United States and European regulators want to standardize derivatives contracts to help cross-border banks fail smoothly. It’s a reminder of how much work still needs to be done to end “too big to fail,” the author says.

headline.main: A Hurdle to Winding Down a Failing Global Bank
